text: Transactivation by <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , the type II bare lymphocyte syndrome - associated factor , requires participation of multiple regions of the <extra_id_0> TATA box binding protein <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

<extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a positive regulator of class II major histocompatibility complex gene transcription that has been found to be defective in one of the five complementation groups of class II major histocompatibility complex - negative cell lines .
Its N-terminal region is capable of activating transcription from a reporter gene when fused to a DNA binding domain .

We have investigated the mechanism of transactivation mediated by the <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation domain by studying its role in the process of transcription initiation and elongation .

Specifically the altered specificity <extra_id_0> TBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TATA box binding protein <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) assay has been used to analyze the response of the <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation domain to mutations in <extra_id_0> TBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> known to disrupt its interaction with its associated general factors .

text: Transactivation by <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was extremely sensitive to a mutation in <extra_id_0> TBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> that in yeast is known to abolish <extra_id_0> VP16 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated transcription but leaves basal transcription unaffected .

A <extra_id_0> TBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutant defective in interaction with <extra_id_0> TBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - associated factor <extra_id_0> TAFII250 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> also failed to mediate transactivation through the <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation domain .

text: Certain interactions between <extra_id_0> TBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and general factors that are specifically required for acidic activation domains were also required for <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated transactivation to reach its full potential .
Finally , like <extra_id_0> VP16 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was able to stimulate elongation of transcription .

Overall the mechanism of transactivation by the human B-cell - specific <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is very similar to that mediated by the herpes virus transactivator <extra_id_0> VP16 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the ways that have been tested .
